1:
I take refuge in Yahweh;\q how will you say to me,
\q "Flee like a bird to the mountain"?
\q
2:
For see! The wicked prepare their bows.\q They make ready their arrows on the strings
\q to shoot in the darkness at the upright in heart.


\q
3:
For if the foundations are ruined,\q what can the righteous do?
\q
4:
Yahweh is in his holy temple;\q his eyes watch, his eyes examine the children of mankind.


\q
5:
Yahweh examines both the righteous and the wicked,\q but he hates those who love to do violence.
\q
6:
He rains burning coals and brimstone upon the wicked;\q a scorching wind will be their portion from his cup!
\q
7: For Yahweh is righteous, and he loves righteousness;\q the upright will see his face.
